rationales.achievement: He worked on the literature review draft that his supervisor called solid, actively pursuing his doctoral publication targets.
rationales.benevolence: He calls his mother every Tuesday and redirects the conversation to ask about Noor's day at the shop, maintaining close family connection despite the distance.
rationales.tradition: The ritualized Tuesday call with his mother follows a scripted pattern of family obligation that he maintains without fail.

rationales.achievement: He agonizes over the late conference paper, measuring himself against his younger cohort-mate Ahmed who already has two journal submissions this year.
rationales.hedonism: He has been eating rice and lentils for two weeks straight to keep rent covered, denying himself basic comfort to sustain his studies.
rationales.benevolence: When Noor calls about the broken printer, he immediately promises to figure it out despite his own financial strain, shielding her from his struggles.
rationales.tradition: He maintains the nightly phone calls with family and the monthly remittances, fulfilling his role as the eldest son supporting the family from abroad.
rationales.security: The printer repair costs more than his usual monthly remittance and he cannot cover it without sacrificing his own basic needs, threatening his financial stability.

rationales.achievement: The supervisor meeting went well, with productive feedback on narrowing scope to make the paper submittable by July.
rationales.hedonism: He sat on a bench in the park by the pond after the meeting, enjoying the moment and calling his mother from a peaceful spot.
rationales.benevolence: He called his mother from the park to share the good news, and felt relief when Noor texted that she found a cheaper repair solution.
rationales.tradition: He tells his mother about the meeting and she responds with 'habibi, you always worry too much,' maintaining their close familial bond.
rationales.security: Noor finding a cheaper repair guy and the supervisor's positive meeting both ease his financial and academic anxiety, restoring a sense of stability.

rationales.power: He fumbled during Q&A in front of twelve faces, his mind locked, hands shaking, and he felt diminished compared to the younger students who are 'sharper on their feet.'
rationales.achievement: Despite the fumble, he had rehearsed four times, prepared clean slides, and organized data meticulously, demonstrating intense commitment to performing well.
rationales.hedonism: He came home and couldn't eat dinner, instead opening his progress spreadsheet where every line has a yellow or red flag, denying himself rest or comfort.
rationales.benevolence: His nudge response reveals the degree was ultimately about his mother watching from the front row and proving the sacrifice wasn't reckless, driven by love for family.
rationales.tradition: He pictured his father watching from the front row before the stroke, seeking the family's recognition and validation of his sacrifices as a dutiful son.
rationales.conformity: He managed to stay composed during the Q&A fumble, sitting down without anyone noticing his shaking hands, maintaining outward professional composure.
rationales.security: Every line on his tracking spreadsheet has yellow or red flags, and he reflects that he 'traded one kind of pressure for another, except this one pays nothing.'

rationales.achievement: He submitted the revised paper draft and is polishing the teaching assistantship application, steadily checking off milestones on his progress plan.
rationales.stimulation: He notices he eats dinner alone most nights and keeps finding reasons not to attend the departmental social, preferring familiar routine over new social situations.
rationales.benevolence: The phone call home was 'normal' for once, with Mama talking about neighbors and Noor complaining about a supplier, and it felt 'lighter' because nobody asked when he was coming back.
rationales.tradition: He maintains the daily family calls and fulfills his role as the distant but dutiful eldest son, finding comfort in the familiar family rhythms.
rationales.security: The supervisor's positive feedback and the uneventful family call create a sense of stability he hasn't had, making the week feel 'quiet for once.'

rationales.achievement: He told Ahmed 'I didn't leave a perfectly good job to do a watered-down version of what I already know,' insisting on pursuing the harder theoretical track.
rationales.self_direction: He explicitly defends his choice to pursue deep theoretical understanding rather than taking the easier applied track, framing it as 'a deliberate choice, not a consolation prize.'
rationales.conformity: He was sharper than expected with Ahmed, pushing back against the assumption that an older industry professional should take the easier route.
rationales.security: He admits the comprehensive exam reading list makes him read the same page four times and that he's keeping pace 'barely,' revealing the precariousness of his position.

rationales.achievement: He worked through three finite element analysis practice problems and got two out of three right, with the third being only a sign error, marking genuine academic progress.
rationales.hedonism: He walked home to the smell of rain and the evening felt genuinely good, savoring the day's satisfaction in a way he hasn't allowed himself before.
rationales.stimulation: He attended the departmental social for the first time and had an engaging hour-long conversation with Priya about soil liquefaction and his Zarqa overpass project.
rationales.self_direction: Something clicked in the modeling chapter he'd been struggling with for weeks, representing an independent intellectual breakthrough on his own terms.
rationales.benevolence: He called his mother and told her about the social, and she said 'finally, you're making friends' in her worried tone; he also saved Noor's photo of the new shop sign.
rationales.tradition: Noor's photo of the family printing shop with a new sign she designed herself, the family name in green, connects him to the family business and heritage he supports from afar.
rationales.security: The academic breakthrough and successful social interaction together provide a sense that he belongs and can do this, establishing firmer ground after months of uncertainty.

rationales.achievement: Getting the teaching assistantship after three semesters of color-coded tracking and relentless effort is concrete evidence that 'someone looked at your file and said yes.'
rationales.hedonism: He sat with the news for a while, allowing himself to feel the satisfaction of a concrete accomplishment rather than immediately moving to the next target.
rationales.self_direction: The TA position validates his deliberate choice to leave industry and pursue the harder academic path, proving the decision was sound.
rationales.benevolence: The extra stipend means he can send Noor more money without skipping meals himself, and that 'matters more to me than the line on my CV.'
rationales.tradition: The achievement fulfills the family-oriented purpose of his PhD, bringing him closer to the moment his father might recognize the sacrifice was worthwhile.
rationales.security: The TA stipend provides financial relief and 'something solid to stand on,' easing the precariousness of his situation.

rationales.achievement: His nudge response reveals the PhD is ultimately about proving 'the years away and the money spent turned into something he can recognize,' seeking family validation for his accomplishment.
rationales.benevolence: He called his mother to share the TA news and she cried, then told him his father smiled, deepening their emotional bond across the distance.
rationales.tradition: His deepest motivation is his father knowing he's 'not wasting this,' seeking the approval of his parents and honoring the family sacrifice that enabled his studies.
